meanings.definition: A moving staircase consisting of an endlessly circulating belt of steps driven by a motor.
meanings.sent1: The escalators at the mall make it easier to go up and down without walking.
meanings.sent2: I took the escalators instead of the stairs to reach the top floor quickly.
meanings.sent3: The escalators seemed to be in a race with the elevator, but the stairs won!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved like escalators, constantly circulating and never stopping.
meanings.sent5: The escalators hummed softly as they carried people effortlessly from one level to another.

meanings.definition: A power-driven set of stairs conveying people upward or downward.
meanings.sent1: The escalators in the subway station help commuters move between levels efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She held onto the handrail as she rode the escalators down to the ground floor.
meanings.sent3: The escalators were feeling tired after carrying so many people all day.
meanings.sent4: His career trajectory resembled an escalator, steadily moving upward with each promotion.
meanings.sent5: The escalators creaked slightly under the weight of the rush hour crowd.
